feed.title: SAP Community - SAP HANA
feed.subtitle: SAP HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: monthly transactional database growth details
entry.content:
Hello SAP Team,

I am able to retrieve the overall database growth details from DB02. Please find below the summary of our SAP HANA database growth for the last 10 months (Jan-2025 to Oct-2025):

DescriptionDetails

Total Database Growth (10 Months)386.28 GBAverage Database Growth per Month~40 GB

However, I am unable to get the month-wise growth details specifically for the Transactional Database.

I have already referred to the following SAP Notes but could not find any suitable script or guidance to extract the monthly transactional data growth:

  • SAP Note 2680392 – How to monitor HANA Database growth history for more than 42 days

  • SAP Note 1969700 – Monitoring HANA database size and growth using SQL queries

Kindly advise on how to get the monthly transactional database growth details — either through any SQL script, system view, or standard report available in HANA Studio or DBACOCKPIT.

Please suggest if there’s an SAP-provided method or note that covers this requirement.

Thanks

entry.title: HANA Dump Analyzer Tool
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I’m currently working with the HANA Dump Analyzer tool to analyze system dumps. When attempting to load a dump file, I encounter an issue that prevents me from proceeding. Could you please help me resolve this so I can fully utilize the tool?

entry.title: Best approach to migrate 1M Customers & Vendors from ECC to BP in S/4HANA – DMC vs CVI?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are preparing a migration from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA and we have approx. 1 million customer and vendor records that must be converted to Business Partners (BP).

We are evaluating the best migration approach and would like input from the community:

Has anyone successfully migrated a very large volume of customers and vendors directly via Data Migration Cockpit (DMC)?

Has anyone enabled CVI (Customer Vendor Integration) in ECC first, converted the master data there, and then migrated only balances / open items to S/4HANA?

For high volumes (1M+ business partners), what is the recommended best practice according to your experience?

Key questions we are trying to answer:

Is it more stable to activate CVI in ECC and synchronize customers/vendors to BP before the migration?

Does DMC scale efficiently for this volume of business partner creation?

Any lessons learned, performance considerations, or pitfalls to avoid?

Any guidance, experience sharing, or official SAP recommendations would be highly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Adaptation project in Fiori HANA: override (onInit, onCustom, etc ) not being called/ not working
entry.content:
I have extended a Fiori HANA App in BAS with an adaptation project and I want to override the methods. 

sap.ui.define(
    [
        'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension'
        //,'sap/ui/core/mvc/OverrideExecution'
    ],
    function (
        ControllerExtension
        //,OverrideExecution
    ) {
        'use strict';
        return ControllerExtension.extend("customer.mytimeeventsextension.CustomListReportController", {        
            override: {                
                onExit: function(){
                    debugger;
                },
                test:function(){
                    
                }
            },
            
        });
    }
);

 

{
  "changeType": "codeExt",
  "reference": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "namespace": "apps/customer.mytimeeventsextension/changes/",
  "creation": "2025-10-31T10:45:14.615Z",
  "projectId": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "moduleName": "customer/mytimeeventsextension/changes/coding/CustomListReportController",
  "support": {
    "generator": "@sap-ux/control-property-editor",
    "sapui5Version": "1.139.0"
  },
  "originalLanguage": "EN",
  "layer": "CUSTOMER_BASE",
  "fileType": "change",
  "fileName": "id_1761907511309_262_codeExt",
  "content": {
    "codeRef": "coding/CustomListReportController.js"
  },
  "texts": {},
  "selector": {
    "controllerName": "module:sap/fe/templates/ListReport/ListReportController.controller"
  }
}

 

{
  "fileName": "manifest",
  "layer": "CUSTOMER_BASE",
  "fileType": "appdescr_variant",
  "reference": "hcm.fio.mytimeevents1",
  "id": "customer.mytimeeventsextension",
  "namespace": "apps/hcm.fio.mytimeevents1/appVariants/customer.mytimeeventsextension/",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "content": [
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "i18n",
        "bundleUrl": "i18n/i18n.properties",
        "supportedLocales": [
          "en","de"
        ],
        "fallbackLocale": ""
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_addNewModelEnhanceWith",
      "content": {
        "modelId": "@i18n",
        "bundleUrl": "i18n/i18n.properties",
        "supportedLocales": [
          "en","de"
        ],
        "fallbackLocale": ""
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_ui5_setMinUI5Version",
      "content": {
        "minUI5Version": "1.120.23"
      }
    },
    {
      "changeType": "appdescr_app_setTitle",
      "content": {},
      "texts": {
        "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties"
      }
    }
  ]
}

In BAS the methods are being called/processed:

 

this error ist OK (the method test doesn't exist but it shows that tries to process it when the app loads)

 Here is the code from SAP deployed. The debugger doesn't stop and the error from above doesn't show up either

entry.title: Missing “External” Checkbox Field in Transaction XDN1
entry.content:
Hello Team,

We are facing an issue where the “External” checkbox field is missing in T-Code XDN1.

I already have SAP_ALL authorization assigned to my user ID.

Does anyone know how to resolve this issue?
Any guidance or related SAP Notes to fix this would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Evaluating Tosca for SAP testing: real-world pros/cons?
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am working with a large conglomerate that is in the middle of evaluating test automation platforms, and Tosca is at the top of the list (The company currently have a mixed landscape: some of our business entities are still on SAP ECC, while others are already on S/4HANA. The plan is to have everyone fully migrated to S/4HANA in the next 2-3 years.)

Would love honest feedback:

  • What are the genuine strengths and “it just works” scenarios for Tosca?

  • What real-world pain points or limitations have you encountered?

  • Any gotchas with custom code, upgrades, or maintenance?

entry.title: Request for Guidance on Integrating SAP HANA On-Premise Database with SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:

We would like to monitor and manage our on-premise HANA system using Cloud ALM, but we are currently unsure about the necessary steps, prerequisites, and configuration required to achieve this.

Could you kindly provide guidance or documentation on how to proceed with this integration?

Thanks.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Extended RAM not showing in HANA database
entry.content:
Dear Team,

I have extended RAM in our Production Server from 512 GB to 570 GB ,

When I check via OS level , its show properly .

But When I check via HANA Studio , Its show only 512 GB .

I check the parameter in Configuration tab in global.ini  the global_allocation_limit

Its value is 0.

Why its not showing  570 GB in HANA Studio .

 

Regards

Jagdish Kumar

entry.title: New SAP learner – looking for free certification and server access guidance
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m new to SAP and currently a college student interested in learning SAP MM and other modules. I want to gain hands-on experience and earn a certificate, but I can’t afford paid servers or subscriptions right now.

Could anyone please guide me on how to access free SAP learning resources, student programs, or free server/demo access for practice?

I would really appreciate any advice or links that can help me start my SAP learning journey.

Thank you so much in advance!

entry.title: intercompany stock transfer with consignment
entry.content:
We have the following requirement

Customer places an order with company A, this should create a consignment stock transfer order to send inventory from company B to company A.  The consignment STO is received into consignment stock (under company B) till the PGI is done against the sales order. What is the standard way of handling this process

entry.title: Configuring SAP Business Workflow for parked documents (FIPP)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

during a SAP S/4HANA implementation, we have the requirement for parked document approvals via SAP Business Workflow (object type FIPP). I need advice on the following issue:

So far, I did the configuration in customizing under ‘Make and Check Settings for Document Parking’, I created the workflow variant, assigned company code and defined release approval paths and procedures for parking documents including mentioning needed subworkflow WS51000020 (FIPP_SUBWFN2, two step approval except initiator). Also, I defined users for release authorizations for each approval level in OBWF. Beforehand, I activated the type linkage in transaction SWE2 for workflow framework WS00400032 for event CREATED as well as event linking in transaction OOCU is activated.

When I create a document with transaction FB01 and save it as completed, I check afterward in FBV3 and see the document is not released as expected. When I check workflow -> workflow overview, I see that workflow is not going through as expected. In display workflow log, I check the error message in work item and it says error in workflow customizing for document parking in OBWE. I checked the transaction and related customizing, but I am unable to find the hidden mistake.

Does anyone have an advice on how to solve this issue? Is there anything else to consider?

Thank you in advance for any advice on this matter

Kind regards

entry.title: Fixed asset posting error
entry.content:
Good day.

I hope you are doing well. I have attended your SAP S/4HANA (Essential) lectures on LinkedIn Learning.

 I have also subscribed to the Michael Management SAP S/4HANA 2022 course to gain more hands-on experience.

While practicing, I have been trying to post a fixed asset purchase entry from a vendor, but I have been unable to complete it successfully. After several attempts, I believe the issue is related to the tax code configuration. I have tried using multiple tax codes, but the system continues to reject the entry.(error message attached)

Upon reviewing the G/L account (screenshot attached), I found that it is linked to a specific tax category. I also checked the configuration settings for the tax codes (attached), but I couldn’t find any relevant input tax code assigned.

Could you please guide me on how to correctly configure or assign the appropriate tax code for posting fixed asset purchase entries? Your guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support and for sharing your valuable knowledge.

Fahim Ghafoor, CMA US

entry.title: How to maintain texts in table T156HT for different languages (Movement Type Help Texts)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to understand how to maintain data in table T156HT.

In transaction OMJJ, I have already maintained the short text for my movement types — that part is working fine, and the text is reflected correctly in transactions like MIGO.

However, I noticed that table T156HT (Movement Type: Help Texts) does not have corresponding entries for these movement types.

Could you please confirm:

  1. Do we need to maintain T156HT manually, or does the system update it automatically from OMJJ?

  2. If it needs to be maintained separately, where exactly should I maintain these texts — especially for different languages (e.g., EN, DE, FR)?

  3. Is there a specific transaction (like SE63 or SE61) or customizing path that updates T156HT correctly in newer SAP versions (S/4HANA)?

Any clarification or SAP note reference would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: How to Preview data of SAP HANA View as other user ?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

In SAP HANA, for example,  there are users A001 and B001.

The password of A001 is unkown.

Log on the SAP HANA system with user A001 and I want to preview data of SAP HANA Views with authority of  B001.

 

How to achieve this ? 

Tks.

entry.title: The Future of SAP: Latest Trends Shaping the Industry in 2025
entry.content:
The SAP landscape is evolving rapidly. Here are the trends every aspiring consultant should know about:

1. AI & Machine Learning

AI is embedded in SAP solutions today. Consultants who understand AI-driven automation are highly sought after.

2. Cloud-First Deployments

S/4HANA Cloud is becoming standard. Cloud expertise is now a premium skill.

3. Sustainability & ESG Reporting

Organizations need consultants to help achieve ESG compliance. New specialization = new opportunities.

4. Low-Code/No-Code Solutions

Configuration skills are more valuable than ever. Rapid implementation is the new standard.

5. Cybersecurity & Data Privacy

Security expertise commands top dollar. Every project requires privacy compliance.

6. Real-Time Analytics

Business intelligence consultants are in high demand. Data storytelling is critical.

7. Extended Supply Chain Networks

Supply chain visibility is booming. Consultants here are building thriving careers.

8. Agile Methodologies

Waterfall is out. Agile, iterative approaches are the new normal.

The Bottom Line

The most valuable consultants in 2025 will specialize in these emerging areas. Don't just follow trends—master one and differentiate yourself.

Which trend excites you most? Which area do you want to specialize in? Drop your thoughts in the comments below!

Let's grow together in this dynamic industry. What's your next move? #                                                                                      #SAP #Trends2025 #CareerGrowth #SAPConsulting #AI #CloudComputing #DigitalTransformation

entry.title: Can SAP Help European CEOs Win in Times of Global Turbulence?
entry.content:
Article Teaser:
You’re leading amid change. Markets shift, regulations tighten, supply chains wobble. How can SAP help you stay ahead, make bold decisions and build resilience?

The New Reality for Leaders

Today, change hits fast. A supplier drops. A new regulation lands. Demand shifts overnight. As a European CEO or CTO, waiting for monthly reports won’t work. You need insight in real time.

Why the ERP Market Matters

The European ERP software market is expected to grow to about USD 36.35 billion in 2025, up from roughly USD 30.82 billion in 2024. 

In the EU, around 73 % of SMEs already reach a basic level of digital intensity, but many still lack high-value tools. 

What SAP Brings to The Table

  • Connected systems: Finance, supply chain, HR and operations talk to each other.
  • Live data insight: You get up-to-date dashboards, not stale reports.
  • Embedded intelligence & automation: SAP brings smart tools that handle routine tasks so your team focuses on strategic work.

Why This Matters to You

When everything is linked, you move faster, decide better, bounce back quicker. Supply disruptions, cost spikes, talent gaps, they still happen. But you’re ready.

A Scenario that Could Be Yours

Imagine this: You see a raw-material price jump. Your system alerts you immediately. You check supplier capacity, stock on hand, and cost impact. You update forecasts and pricing in hours, not days. That’s connected enterprise in action.

Actions for Leaders

  • Align your data: Make sure all teams define and use metrics the same way.
  • Set governance and trust: Know who uses what data, why, and how decisions are made.
  • Enable agility: Give your teams tools and permission to act quickly with insight.

Conclusion

Uncertainty is here to stay. Speed and insight matter more than ever. SAP gives you the foundation. You bring the leadership. Together, you turn change intoan  advantage.

Soft CTA:
If you’re ready to explore how SAP solutions can strengthen your leadership in turbulent times, join discussions in the SAP Community or connect with experts who guide change across Europe. Feel free to reach me at neel.panchal@stridelysolutions.com to learn more.

entry.title: S/4 HANA 2025 - ABAP Cloud Outbound http Client
entry.content:
How can we set up on-premise SAP S/4 HANA 2025 Outbound HTTP services, using only released APIs?

Package S_UNIFIED_CON_HTTP_CLIENT is full of released APIs, including CL_WEB_CLIENT_PROVIDER which looks promising. This class is based on Communication Targets. From various docs and tutorials, communication targets require 1) communication scenario and 2) outbound service to function.

From Eclipse ADT - Neither of these ABAP repository objects are available on our S/4 HANA 2025 system. Hoping to get clarification on the ABAP Cloud compatible (released APIs only) of using HTTP Clients. 

SAP Communication Targets Tutorial:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n6_rekYKcwY
